title: The Forgetting
outcome: Three days after Harmony Reset ends, the BCI system starts erasing vast amounts of historical data, including citizen scores and surveillance logs. Citizens and officials are thrown into chaos as whole segments of the city lose records and accountability evaporates. Some districts celebrate, others fight to preserve what remains. Rada discovers the forgetting was set in motion by Halden before his death. This forces citizens to choose between reconstructing the system or letting collective memory reshape society.

events.description: BCI system begins erasing historical citizen scores and surveillance archives in multiple districts, sparking confusion and panic across the city.
Groups of citizens gather to either celebrate liberation from oversight or frantically try to reconstruct records, fearing lost justice or future abuses.

Rada discovers documentation showing Halden scheduled the data purge as a last resort should BCI begin breaking down, setting off a heated citywide debate about the value of memory and accountability.
Council members openly disagree on whether to revive or destroy the remnants of the BCI. Residents stage daily assemblies, demanding a vote on the system’s survival.
With memory fading, rival citizen groups fight street battles over access to surviving archived data; the city veers toward a final referendum on the fate of algorithmic rule.
